Description: Political Regulation to enforce accessibility in grocery stores
Watch for the blind that is not audio based
Takes video stream of phone to assistant to decode and read
Application for device with camera
Device that goes on shopping cart
amazon alexa and small camera to identify clothing
uses a small camera and amazon Alexa to ID
product certification that shows that product was made with blind in mind
guide dog for the blind that takes batteries
similar to the guide dog, but flies
instead of a big tablet, a handheld braille reader
Discrete way of reading in public through braille displayed on a bracelet
Mobile phone stand scanner w flashlight for optimum scans
rings on left and right hand to tell you to turn either way
wearable that discretely tells you when to turn by GPS
attachment to glasses that can sense obstacles
a larger braille note that is only an attachment but can read many lines
buttons on the back of a phone case to tell you which way to turn
button to press each time you pass a landmark, noting it for future navigation
small sticker that transmits signals to tell the blind the location of signs
Alexa-based app that simplifies the food ordering process
Alexa-based app that uses computer vision to identify the status of dials around the household (laundery machine, oven etc.)
Alexa-based app that scrapes internet for indoor layout maps of shopping malls etc and communicates that information to user
Alexa-based app that uses the wifi signals emitted by nearby phones to gauge a map of indoor spaces
Computer screens are hard for the blind to navigate. This display creates a 3D extruded version of computer screen displays that the blind user can feel
An attachment that connects to white canes and communicates to the user if the traffic signal is white or red
Braille input/output panel that attaches to back of smartphone and displays in braille whatever text the user has his finger over
A camera mounted on earphones is at shoulder level and can read sign boards using computer vision. The camera then communicates to the user by means of voice what the sign board says
A phone app that identifies and reads the label of items that the user is holding in his/her hand
A robot that helps the blind navigate indoor spaces like airports and shopping malls
RF tags installed on street posts and landmarks for easy identification. Camera on user can easily pick up on RF tags to help navigation

Concept Name: Gloves with Sonar and Object ID
Description: Gloves w/ sonar that can identify obstacles. Possibly extended to object identification tech.
App that provides indoor navigation inside buildings, malls, theaters, etc
App that lets you scan barcodes, syncs with store to provide info on product, description, sales and promotions
Food and spice dispenser that outputs exact amount specified by user
Verbal "walk sign" that can be retro-fitted to regular cross walks
Bracelet that uses haptic feedback to indicate directions
News app that collects articles from popular sites and transcribes them verbally
Measuring cup that tells user how much of something in the cup, or can be used to set an amount of substance to pour
Appliances that can be set verbally or have mechanical buttons to make it easier for visually impaired to use
A torchlight that identifies the object that it is shining light on
An app that provides visual feedback of the blind user's surroundings (e.g. if the doors and windows are closed)
A device that uses ultrasound to map the blind user's surroundings
Sensors within the shoe help the blind detect perturbations in the ground
Users tap their phone on NFC reader upon entering a space and get information anounced through alexa of the surroundings
A retractable white cane that can operate effectively using sensors even when collapsed
Blind can use braille output to understand what is on screen. Seeing can use braille output to check if there are notification while phone is in pocket
Device uses blacklight to reveal stains invisible to even the seeing. On a basic level can also be used to identify normal stains
Device that helps blind people identify when it is safe to cross a junction. Seeing users on their phone can also use this device when at crosswalks

Box stores away spices when there is limited display space. On voice input, the desired bottle is outputted from the box. Useful for seeing users who struggle with storing their spices and blind users who cannot identify spices
Front door camera that recognizes faces or particular RF codes to confirm who is at the door
Device that lets you navigate to a particular person/individual. Can be useful in crowded spaces
Accessory that can act as an easy to read braille screen
Device that stores and dispenses pills.
A pair of sunglasses that can recognize people, staircases, sidewalks
Credit card that has braille #'s to make it easy to read for visually impaired
Scanner on doors that can detect when someone or something enters the room. It can be used to help orient and navigate for the blind within buildings or keep track of your devices
IoT device that checks if doors and windows, appliances and lights off
App or device that can easily read/process bills (such as utilities and credit cards) if in paper form, or can consolidate them easily for the visually impaired to access
Small device that you can clip on an item. If you accidentally leave the item and walk away, it buzzes you. Also, if you can't find an  object, it will buzz to help you find it.
cane that detects changes in coefficient of friction
modify audio of speaker to reflect facial expressions
helps indicate first and last step so we dont trip and fall
communal living is tough when everyone isn't on the same page
blind people rely on auditory cues for emotion

Concept Name: Heat braclet that reflects time of day
Description: the blind can't sense ambient light (day/night cycles)
two cameras for stereo vision, converts stereo vision to tactile surface on forehead or under eyes
special breed of dog that does not look cute/petable
uses crispr to create a human/electrode interface that produces good results and low risk of complications/scarring
thin, transparent, rigid, discrete cane for detecting objects above
Discreet safety tracking that detects if you're going the wrong way for uber, etc, and buzzes w trouble
Super thin and lightweight cane, similar to a fencing sword. Stylish and modern
A cane with a reflective surface, like that of bikers, to keep people safe in the dark
wearable around one's neck that looks like a bluetooth device/headphones that provides both sound and directional navigation
Table that has a tactile surface that pops up according to digital displays
Ring that commands your phone to read you notifications, single hand usage
App that automatically adjusts a photo for max reading clarity, meant for the visually impaired to be able to zoom in on text
Tangible, palm sized item that detects color inputs and outputs a tangible reaction for the entirely blind to experience mood from an environment
Trackpack that changeshome settings like temperature and light via gestures
A responsive floor/environment that guides the user via collapsing grass or trembling tiles. Can also be used for retail experiences
